page.title: 15Recreation
page.content: Chertsey has many open areas used for sporting activities. Chertsey Meads is used for British Motor Cross (BMX) trials. The Abbey Fields are used by the local boys' football team, Abbey Rangers, on Sunday mornings. Victory Park, Addlestone has tennis courts, bowling green and areas for football and cricket. Abbey Barn is owned and used by the Acorn Theatre Group who rehearse regularly on Saturday afternoons. The Weybridge Rowing Club is based at the confluence of the rivers Wey and Thames. It has equipment for rowing and sculling. There are no swimming pools or cinemas in the area. The nearest place with these facilities is Staines, which is about five miles from Chertsey.
